body.p: The following parameters are available in the oXygen transformation scenario that uses the Dita Map PDF - WYSIWYG, that uses the DITA-OT CSS Publishing to PDF plugin. Other DITA-OT standard parametters were omitted for clarity.

row.entry: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used in addition to the dita.css.list parameter. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons.
Specifies the master file for your documentation project.
Specifies whether the DITA-OT deletes the files in the temporary directory after it finishes a build. Allowed values: "yes" (default) "no"
One of chemistry - this is the default, antenna-house, or prince.
Path to the Antenna House executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\AHFCmd.exe" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF.

Path to the oXygen PDF Chemistry executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\chemistry.bat" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF. If this parameter is not set, the plugin will use the system's PATH environment variable to find and start oXygen PDF Chemistry.
Path to the Prince executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\prince.exe" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF.
